intro: Strobilanthes viscosa var. viscosa, commonly known as the sticky strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a sticky texture. The plant produces showy, clustered inflorescences with small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
